intro: Preslaea, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small, herbaceous, and often grow in rocky or alpine environments. They are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are usually white or yellow in color. Preslaea species are known for their ability to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor soils. The genus includes several species, many of which are found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
